sourceMeaningMnemonic: Picture a <radical>shellfish</radical> <radical>lifeguard</radical>. They're not going anywhere. First, they're a shellfish, so they can't really move. And, they're a lifeguard, so they need to be in their lifeguard tower. How does this shellfish lifeguard get stuff? Through <kanji>subscription</kanji> services.
meaningInfo: See a bunch of subscription boxes around the lifeguard tower. It gets everything this way.
readingMnemonic: The shellfish lifeguard's favorite <kanji>subscription</kanji> is its subscription to <ja><reading>こう</reading>いち</ja> magazine. It has all the latest <ja>こういち</ja> versions, news, and interviews.
readingInfo:
See the shellfish lifeguard drooling as its <ja>こういち</ja> magazine subscription arrives. "I will read this one now, but I can't wait until next month," it says as a boat sinks in the distance.

Hint: when you see the "lifeguard" radical, the reading is probably going to be <ja>こう</ja>.
